intro: Govantesia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Govantesia is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
